articles.headline: China Imposes New Tariffs on U.S. Vehicles
articles.snippet: The new duties, which apply mainly to sport utility vehicles and large cars, signal an escalation in trade hostilities.
articles.abstract: The new duties, which apply mainly to sport utility vehicles and large cars, signal an escalation in trade hostilities.
articles.lead_paragraph: GUANGZHOU, China — The Chinese government increased trade tensions with the Obama administration Wednesday evening by unexpectedly imposing antidumping and antisubsidy tariffs on imports of sport utility vehicles and midsize and large cars from the United States.

articles.headline: Poland Skirts Euro Zone Woes, for Now
articles.snippet: Not using the shared currency turns out to have been a blessing for Poland, though there are signs of trouble.
articles.abstract: Not using the shared currency turns out to have been a blessing for Poland, though there are signs of trouble.
articles.lead_paragraph: WARSAW — Does Poland have the last healthy economy in Europe?

articles.headline: Junkyard Gives Up Secret Accounts of Massacre in Iraq
articles.snippet: Hundreds of pages of interviews with Marines, once closely guarded as secrets of war, were meant to be destroyed as the last American troops prepare to leave Iraq.
articles.abstract: Hundreds of pages of interviews with Marines, once closely guarded as secrets of war, were meant to be destroyed as the last American troops prepare to leave Iraq.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD — One by one, the Marines sat down, swore to tell the truth and began to give secret interviews discussing one of the most horrific episodes of America’s time in Iraq: the 2005 massacre by Marines of Iraqi civilians in the town of Haditha.

articles.headline: Lines Drawn on Antipiracy Bills
articles.snippet: The House and the Senate are looking to cut off oxygen for sites that offer free copies of entertainment by taking aim at search engines like Google and Yahoo that allow the pirates to function.
articles.abstract: The House and the Senate are looking to cut off oxygen for sites that offer free copies of entertainment by taking aim at search engines like Google and Yahoo that allow the pirates to function.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Type “download movies for free” into Google, and up pops links to sites like the Pirate Bay, directing users to free copies of just about any entertainment   — the latest “Twilight” installment, this week’s episode of “Whitney,” the complete recordings of the Red Hot Chili Peppers.

articles.headline: Beyond the Passé in Tech Gifts
articles.snippet: Think outside the iPhone box when choosing gifts for the tech-minded. Consider a water clock or a portable Wi-Fi hot spot.
articles.abstract: Think outside the iPhone box when choosing gifts for the tech-minded. Consider a water clock or a portable Wi-Fi hot spot.
articles.lead_paragraph: No 7-year-old ever said, “The holidays are so stressful!” When you’re young, the end of the year is always thrilling.

articles.headline: In a Tactical Shift, Romney Trains Sights on Gingrich
articles.snippet: Mitt Romney admitted that he was bracing for a far rougher slog through the early Republican nominating contests than he had envisioned.
articles.abstract: Mitt Romney admitted that he was bracing for a far rougher slog through the early Republican nominating contests than he had envisioned.
articles.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney, his presidential aspirations suddenly endangered by Newt Gingrich’s rapid resurgence, is employing aggressive new arguments in an effort to disqualify Mr. Gingrich as a credible choice to Republicans, calling him “zany” in an interview on Wednesday and questioning his commitment to free enterprise.
articles.byline: By Jeff Zeleny, Michael Barbaro and Ashley Parker

articles.headline: Congress Takes Up a Partisan Battle, Again, Over Spending
articles.snippet: For the third time this year, Congress is dancing on the edge of a precipice as it is locked in a partisan battle over fiscal measures.
articles.abstract: For the third time this year, Congress is dancing on the edge of a precipice as it is locked in a partisan battle over fiscal measures.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Their poll numbers sinking, their constituents badly bruised by economic hardship and with millions of American workers about to get a sudden and unexpected tax increase, what are members of Congress discussing?

articles.headline: Talk of Aid From Russia Buoys Markets in Europe
articles.snippet: Russia said that it might pledge up to $20 billion via the International Monetary Fund to lend support to the euro zone.
articles.abstract: Russia said that it might pledge up to $20 billion via the International Monetary Fund to lend support to the euro zone.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Europe took a breather Thursday as a surprisingly strong Spanish bond auction and hints of Russian bailout money for the region provided at least a temporary sense of calm in the financial markets.
articles.byline: By Stephen Castle and David Jolly

articles.headline: Your Life on Facebook, in Total Recall
articles.snippet: The social network is rolling out a revamped profile feature called Timeline that makes a user’s entire history of photos, links and other items much more accessible with a single click.
articles.abstract: The social network is rolling out a revamped profile feature called Timeline that makes a user’s entire history of photos, links and other items much more accessible with a single click.
articles.lead_paragraph: Remember those karaoke videos from three years ago that somehow wound up on Facebook? They were embarrassing for the few hours they spent at the top of your Facebook profile, and then they were buried under a cascade of new updates.
